intro: Polygala ovata, commonly known as the oval milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, yellowish-green flowers that are often arranged in spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, and it thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Polygala ovata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
